text: maybe a little bit more kerning on the bottom tagline?
spose that wouldn’t hurt since the crankshaft name is wider. I just wouldn’t go too far with it.
yeah… definitely nowhere near the amount of it on the main name. maybe just like 1px or so. (it was hard to read)
Got to agree with <@U22PKFRU5> . Not keen on the logo icon. Whats the thinking behind the name? Crankshaft??
<https://github.com/TheWebTech/CrankShaft#crankshaft>

jist of the name is a HubSpot joke or continuation of their theme.

A flywheel is powered by a crankshaft. Without the crankshaft the flywheel doesn’t work. Thus the name.

<https://www.thebritagency.com/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202018-09-10%20at%2011.30.40%20AM-1.png>
You've been shafted <@UGMGP7A72> :smile:

The name itself I think was a pretty good idea, a bunch of us voted on it, <@U26BLKGE4> came up with it. What I like about it is that it sounds technical, which it is, but it feels like it can fit into the HubSpot universe. It’s also pretty unique

I understand the thinking behind it but from somebody who hasn’t been in the HubSpot community long it doesn’t scream framework to me.

It sounds like if I use it I’m going to have to get my hands dirty trying to make it work…hope that makes sense.

it does make sense. I hear ya. At the same time though I don’t know how much that really matters, because there are a lot of frameworks out there that aren’t super “bootstrap” type named where that connection isn’t that obvious.

example shopify’s timber, or polaris.

or Google’s “material”
bulma
Susy
Pure
Miligram
those names aren’t like synonyms for “quick-start”

was literally typing this while <@U7SL518D6> just posted
>meh, Shopify’s framework was Timber…  “Google” didn’t even mean anything when they first started

Shopify’s does mean something though. Timber IE Timber framework.

Google’s material again Material as in you can use it.  Maybe I’m just over thinking the name
right, but in essence those are both just naming a “part”, and well, a crankshaft is an important part. the foundation of a combustion engine

>a shaft driven by or driving a crank that helps the engine turn the wheels
this framework will be foundational to helping design / develop sites
<https://giphy.com/gifs/trump-michael-donald-UlqLDtI8Qc0j6>
I’m not trying to be hard-work just trying to give some feedback
that’s totally fine. Not trying to shoot you down. all feedback is welcome on the project, and if the active community around it thinks any part of it should change it can change.
<@U7SL518D6> i’ll let you collect a list of any changes and ill make them all at once…IF this is the direction we want to go with the logo.
:rainbow:

smart thinking Jon, avoids you making a bunch of changes if people ultimately want to go a dif direction.

*How about this, if anyone wants to contribute their logo ideas, you have until next Friday*
If by Friday no one has submitted anything new we’ll go based on the poll we took above(including new votes that come in)

And polish whichever logo the majority wanted
I’m wondering if you tried integrating the letters `CS` into the actual crankshaft logo design - could look cool! I like your direction

Just a reminder if you’re not feeling design inclined but want to contribute in other ways check out the  issues see what resonates with you and how you could help: <https://github.com/TheWebTech/CrankShaft/issues>
Several of the issues are more planning/conceptual than actual coding so even if you’re brain is tired on a Friday evening, you can probably handle it.
Glad you brought it up <@UGMGP7A72> - it's good to have some debate :slightly_smiling_face: It creates a better end result. Keep the ideas/feedback coming. :raised_hands::pray:
